settings.title: Rehydration
settings.subtitle: Rehydration treatment is designed to restore fluid balance and treat diarrhoea. The body needs fluids to function throughout the day and diarrhoea or dehydration can result in significant water loss.

settings.title: What is a rehydration treatment used for?
settings.text: Rehydration treatment is used to treat acute diarrhoea, help replace fluids in the body and restore natural salt balance. It prevents dehydration.

settings.title: How to take a rehydration treatment?
settings.text: Rehydration solutions can be dissolved in a glass of water. The solution essentially contains natural salts and glucose and is safe to be taken once or twice a day for adults.

settings.title: Dehydration Defined
settings.text: Losing 1% or more fluid from your body can lead to Dehydration. It is the lack of sufficient water in the body.

settings.title: Diarrhoea Prevalence in Children
settings.text: Diarrhoea can be fatal if not treated in children below the age of five years. Diarrhoea causes dehydration that can increase the severity of the condition.

settings.title: Buy Rehydration Medication
settings.text: “Rehydration is the process of restoring water and electrolytes to the body. It is important to rehydrate after exercising, especially in hot weather. Symptoms of dehydration include thirst, dark urine, fatigue, and headache.To prevent dehydration, drink plenty of fluids before, during, and after exercise. Water is the best choice for most people. However, if you are exercising for more than an hour or in hot weather, you may need a sports drink that contains electrolytes!”
settings.name: Dr Sameer Nakedar

settings.title: What does the rehydration solution contain?
settings.text: The rehydration solution will contain glucose and salts that essentially treat short-term diarrhoea. The salts will replace existing fluids and salts.

settings.title: How long does it take to work?
settings.text: The medicine should work instantly and help you feel better within a day. If your symptoms do not go away within 24 to 48 hours, consult a doctor immediately.

settings.title: How to prevent dehydration?
settings.text: Fruits and vegetables with a high water quantity as well as juices can help replenish lost fluids in the body. It is important to drink plenty of water during the summer to prevent dehydration.

settings.title: What causes dehydration?
settings.text: Vomiting and Diarrhoea are the leading causes of dehydration. However, it largely depends on the climate and physical activity levels of the individual. Too much exercise in the summer can cause dehydration.
